Request an Appointment

Back to top

Although we can accommodate walk-ins during normal reading room hours, we recommend that you book an appointment in advance to ensure that the required space, materials, or equipment are available during your visit. Virtual consultations with a member of our staff are also available.

If you require access to materials outside of these hours, please email lib-specialcollections@fsu.edu to discuss further options.

Strozier Library Special Collections Research Center

Appointments can be made at least 1 week in advance for a maximum of 6 hours.

Claude Pepper Library

Appointments can be made at least 1 week in advance for a maximum of 4 hours.

Virtual Consultation

Appointments can be made at least 1 week in advance for a maximum of 2 hours.

Getting to the Library

Back to top

Where to Park

  • For the Special Collections Research Center, Norwood Reading Room and Exhibit Room: Metered parking in the Call Street Garage or Traditions Way Garage
  • For the Claude Pepper Library and Museum: Call Street Garage
  • For the Heritage Museum: Traditions Way Garage or St. Augustine Garage

You can also purchase a Visitor's Pass for the duration of your visit. For more information about the pass and for general parking information for FSU, see the Visitor page at FSU Transportation and Parking Services.

If you need special accommodation for parking during your visit, please contact Special Collections & Archives directly at lib-specialcollections@fsu.edu.
